page.title: 07Transport/bus
page.content: The Scottish Midland{Bus} Group,W.Alexander&Sons, heve their area{depot}in Stirling Road. There are up to 62{transport}vehicles garaged there:-single and double deckers, coaches and the destinctive yellow learner driver vehicles. Until 1925, there were{tramcars},but these have long since been replaced by buses. The buses are maintained, repaired, serviced and cleaned at the depot. There is a test centre to test buses and drivers for the midland section, a trim shop which refurbishes the upholstry, a body shop for body work on the buses and a paint shop for painting and retouching the buses in stock. The buses are externally cleanedin a huge car wash, then they a hand cleaned internally. The bus group organises tours throughout the British Isles and into Europe.
